rComments: It's an interesting class on Federalism. But get ready to present your policy paper (research) in front of the PCO team of the government of Canada. Otherwise, good class.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Lecture heavy', 'Clear grading criteria']

rComments: an amazing prof! he seems intimidating at first but after one email you can tell he actually really cares about his students. his lectures were so easy to get through and the TAs are kind and want the best for you as well! in my opinion if you put in the effort you are guaranteed to do well

Professor Lecours was one of the best lecturers I had this semester. As a first-year student, Professor Lecours inspired me to pursue a degree in the political science field. His TA's were AWESOME and gave GREAT feedback. The TAs and the prof actually cared about your interest in this field! would definitely take another course from him again.

Profs an absolute beauty. This was by far my favorite course so far at uOttawa. His lectures are engaging and hes really well spoken, plus if you like politics some of his stories are really interesting. Hes helpful in answering questions and accessible outside class. The work isn't that hard, there's only two papers and a final take home exam.
teacherRatingTags: ['Accessible outside class', 'Graded by few things', 'Amazing lectures ']

rComments: Prof Lecours doesn't post slides, everything on exams is from what he says during lectures. Exams are straightforward, with no curveballs. He cares about his students and encourages class discussion and questions. If you get a chance to take one of his classes, do it!

He was an amazing lecturer! Clear, concise, no tangents. No slides, but if you just take good notes or read the textbook you'll do well. Exams were easy, but your answers should be detailed. I always loved going to class and listening to him, he was clearly super knowledgeable.

I loved his lectures. He is interesting and clear. But its impossible to get a good grade. Its as if nothing is good enough. TAs were horrible. Just avoid this class as a whole. The whole class was averaging a C.
Although he doesn't post slides all the info you need is said in class
Andre Lecours rarely is available for any critical feedback and does not provide a clear criteria for his exams or essays.

Andre is my favourite professor at uOttawa. I've had him for three courses now CanPol, Nationalism & Canadian Parliamentary Governance, and each course proves his knowledge and teaching skills. I'd encourage everyone to take his courses and show up to class and engage in the discussion, you'll learn a lot & it will set you up for the paper & exam!
teacherRatingTags: ['Graded by few things', 'Get ready to read', 'Amazing lectures ']

rComments: Professeur Lecours is an eminence in his field (Nationalism, comparative politics) and a widely cited author. Therefore, consider yourself privileged to have a class with him. He's an engaging lecturer, who knows his material inside out, not because he has it memorized, but because he made research himself on the given topic. Great person too!
Lecours is a good professor. However, I personally didn't like the course Nationalism. I found it harder than my other political science classes and regretted taking it as an elective.
teacherRatingTags: ['Graded by few things', 'Tough grader', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Attendance is absolutely mandatory he just has a list of events/subjects and just talks about them and that is what the majority of the exams cover. The TA's marked the essay and they are awful, harsh and mean about criticism and just overall ridiculous, most of the class gave their essay back to be remarked. Prof is great and reasonable

Prof. Lecours was a good professor who knew his material very well. I skipped most classes, but thoroughly read every reading and studied hard. Class attendance is however very important with him. Overall, good professor.

Professor Lecours is overall very good. He does not post slides but a lot of the material can be found by watching youtube videos and basic google searches anyways. He hands back test and paper grades very fast, its actually impressive. The grades are made up of 2 tests and 1 paper which are all fairly straight forward. Do take this prof!

If paying attention in class isn't your forte, you're not going to pass. His lectures are based on what is said in class. For exams, the more information and detail you know about a topic, the better. He's definitely a great lecturer, I never missed a class.
Prof. Lecours had clearly-outlined expectations of his students and the exams were a direct reflection of the (quite heavy) material covered in lectures.

Average professor. He does not write and ONLY speaks in class. Sometimes, it is difficult to follow when you are typing and he continues speaking. He is a tough grader so do not expect to pass with little studying.

He did not give any notes, all were to be taken from his  lectures - other than a general outline for each class. He was quite straightforward with what to expect on exams and gives you the midterm questions right away. Quite nice, gives concrete examples, also easy to understand. Did not need the textbook just attend his classes + take good notes!
-grades the paper really hard -rarely at office hours -Success on exam is based on how well and detailed your response is, so know everything

I had him for both POL1101 and POL2101. His teaching style is good if you're an auditory learner - he does not use slides and just speaks. I typed everything he said, condensed it later, and then reviewed that and did well. Do, however, review key terms as they pop up on exams. He's super easy to talk to, so go see him outside of class if you need!

It is best to study everything you learned for the exam as he is not very specific on what will be on it (random articles included). Even if he touched on something in class, it may be on the test or exam. He also is a pure lecturer and does not use slides, which can be interesting but means that you have to listen hard and go to all classes.

Very good lecturer. Managed to make a class whose subject I though would be boring beyond infinity into the best class of the semester, and explained it perfectly. Also, his well-placed dry humor and disposition to tackle present issues in politics  the class make the difference.  Summing it up: it's an easy A because it's him that's teaching it.

Great Class, the textbook is unnecessary as he tells you everything he needs in lectures. Adding on to that, an amazing lecturer and he teaches to the test so as long as you study well and just regurgitate what he taught on the exam then getting 80-90s on the midtermfinal should be no problem.

This is the 2nd class I take with Professor Lecours. Personally I don't think the course (Federalism) was that useful. It wasn't hard and I got good marks. A lot of the course material seemed common sense so not well organized on his part. Lecours is a great prof, organized, reasonable expectations but I wouldn't recommend this course

Overall okay class, if you take this class as a elective, just don't, you will struggle. Sometimes he will end the class with a certain topic & says that he will go back but the next class he's on a different topic, can be somewhat confusing. Midterms &exams are straightforward as long as you study REALLY REALLY well otherwise don't take it for fun
Loved him! Was always excited for his classes. WHATTTa cutie :) Also felt very confident after his exams

His lectures are incredible! Proffesor LeCours is so knowledgable. I felt that after every class I knew a lot more! You have to work hard, especially on the essay and study properly for the mid terms. He is straightforward, he does not use powepoints which, is fantastic because he just speaks and the knowledge that pours out leaves you in awe!

I LOVE HIM!!! PLEASE TAKE HIS CLASSES! you will fall in love with political science. he is so great. i took 3 classes with him, all within a year and a half. i think mr. lecours is the most amazing prof. he teaches so well. theres no powerpoint, he talks and conveys his lectures in a  way that is really easy to understand.
He's alright, students learn by copying notes from what he says. His midterms and exam aren't that difficult just as long as you study.
Great professor! Very knowledgeable about the subject material he is conveying. Can't wait to have him this semester for Federalism.

His lectures were full of information and he communicated with students really well. He wants you to ask questions and asks if you understand concepts, which is really good if you haven't taken a political science class before. Midterms and final paper relate to course content, although the TAs were unreachable until the first midterm. Great class!

Lecours posts a brief outline of each lecture each week so you know what to look for in the textbook, which is really helpful. He doesn't use slides, he just talks - he's super smart! I absolutely love him, he's the best prof I've ever had. Great sense of humour, always answers your questions, and usually ends classes early. Highly recommended!!

He's a great prof. He's very clear in his lectures, not so much for the assignments and exam; its pretty vague. He's really interesting and knowledgeable in european politics and has great stories. We also had a great guest lecturer from the EU. Warning : he doesn't post the material online. Only 2 exams and one paper as evaluations.
Great prof. His midterms arent that hard, and need to go to class. Very clear in his lectures and does not ramble on
Awesome prof! Very clear with his content and what is expected. Textbook is said to be required but he covers all the material you need in his lectures. Definitely recommned!
Professor Lecours just has so much knowledge to share. Expectations are clear and reasonable. Pretty much the best professor in the political science program.

AMAZING PROF,! take his class. i had him in intro to canadian politics. he made canadian politics fun. His method of teaching is very traditional, which i love. he is very organized and knowledgeable. i would definitely recommend taking his classes.
Very clear in what is expected. Doesn't use slides but is very direct in the points he is making. TAs marked the essay we did. Fairly easy prof! Did not use the book at all.

Danny from Full House - not even kidding. He's a great prof, very clear in his expectations, and is quick to return assignments/midterms. I thought he was a pretty easy marker and enjoyed the class immensely when I took it.

Andre Lecours is a beauty. The guy knows how to teach and convey information very well. His TAs mark a lot of the stuff, but they give you the questions for the exams ahead of time. You learn a lot, and his class is really well organized and simple to follow. Recommend this guy to anyone!
Lecours is a great professor. Took both POL1101 and POL2101. Doesn't use slides, but course material doesn't change much. Talks at an great speed for note-taking and is generally engaging.

Interesting class, goes way of topic, never know what's important and what's not. Hard grader, takes of random points that add up into a grade that doesn't reflect the work. Bad grade on essay, got a 1/5 in the English section when TA had more grammar mistakes than me. Interesting, but not a bird course.

Lecours is hands down the biggest beauty at UofO, don't debate it dude, he is. Has an incredible ability to make all the concepts incredibly clear, reading the textbook is only complementary. His TA's provide a review before exams which is very helpful (they tell you the questions on the zammer). 100% do not miss out on this class

Very easy to understand, very easy marker. Rarely attended class and didn't really have to read the textbook and still managed to get a good grade. He speaks slow and well-paced, but does not use slides.
Very clear in class. Lectures were really interesting and engaging and he usually gave time to have class discussion about current event in Canadian politics.

He wants you to be able to walk away knowing the fundamentals. Attend class instead of reading the text because he'll emphasize what will likely be on the exam during the lecture and the readings will just dilute that with information he's not interested in. If you ask a question, make sure you and your classmates are prepared for a lengthy answer.

Great Professor. If you are not a fan of multiple choice, this is your guide. Gives you a good idea about what you need to know come exam time. Well thought out, doesn't give notes but posts an outline on what he will be discussing prior to the lecture. Easy to do well, if you follow lectures and read the text.

Had Professor Lecours for two classes, and this one was my recent one which is federalism. You can tell he is passionate about the material, which makes the lectures more interesting. His marking is average, so that means you will have to put a good amount of effort to get a high mark. Also, readings are VERY important prior to class.
Horrible prof, his feedback is useless. His exams are easy enough, but his class is boring and when you go talk to him for help he hardly shows up and is very smug.

Worst prof ever! Boring as hell.  Doesn't use slides and the textbook is written by him yet he hardly uses it and it cost over $170 which makes a nice little profit to himself. First midterm you need to study everything and he is not clear on his essay. Stay away

I think this could have been a great class but you really had to have an interest in Canadian Politics. It's not that he's boring. The material is. That being said, it's not hard to get a good mark at all. I barely went to class, just read the textbook and emailed when necessary. Got a B+. Not bad. He's a nice guy too.
Lecours is a huge beauty. I'll definetly look for another class with him. Amazing prof.

Great Prof! This is my second class with him and I will for sure look for a third. He brings in guest lecturers that are always really interesting, midterms and final exams are straight forward and easy if you've been to class and read over your notes!
Great prof! Very funny and helpful and is arguably one of the best professors in the University!

AMAZING PROF! waking up for class was no struggle; his lectures are incredibly engaging and objective. I learned a lot from him, I can only pray I have him again! His exams are really straight forward, as long as you pay attention in class and/or do the readings... I'd definitely recommend him for any future student. A really great guy!

This is my favorite prof for my first year intro to political studies. He intelligently uses his words and phrases in order to make it extremely comprehendible despite his french accent. This is a class where it is entirely possible to acheive an A+ so long as you simply show up to class and review your notes before the mid terms and exam.

Good prof and a good class.  Topics are not always the most exciting but he generates and moderates class discussion very very well.  Accommodating, but is clear about what is expected.  I highly suggest this prof and class.

His lectures, if not stimulating, are very informative. His exams, on the other hand, expect way too much information (6 full 2 page answers in less than 1.5 hrs) considering the time limit, and his TA in this class is an extremely hard marker. He complained that the class' midterm marks were low, perhaps his expectations are too high.

AMAZING PROF! Although lectures are not the most stimulating, he really knows what he's talking about, he's unbiased, and conveys the subject effectively. He also invites really interesting guest speakers to provide another view on the topic being studied. I'd definitely take another course with him.

GREAT PROF!! one of my fav classes and fav profs! really knows his stuff, def recommend to take it in the summer (final was a take home :D) will def take another class with him in the future. not sure if the TA was an easy marker or i just really understood this class, overall he is really easy to understand and a great guy

Professor Lecours is by far one of the best professors I've had in university. Has a perfect speaking pace for you to write everything down and knows his material inside and out. Attending lectures is mandatory if you want to do well - would definitely recommend him for any politics course in the future!

He is a good professor and is clear but he needs to create some powerpoint slides and put them on virtual campus. I found that he tended to discuss current events a lot which was interesting but I found we wasted a lot of time doing so. We were 2-3 weeks behind when we finished the course. His exams were pretty easy.

He is not particularly interesting, and can be quite dull at times. He is a co-author of the textbook, and as a result you will find yourself being taught exactly what the readings say. His marking is very hard. If you don't follow his ideas exactly don't expect a great mark. He is helpful if you ask him questions, and puts all his notes online.
has strcutured method of teaching, is very clear and the pace of lecture is perfect... his exams are challenging however if you attend class and read up on relevant material than you are good to go

Was pretty helpful during class (though I nvr contacted him during office hours). For me, I found that it was very easy to understand his lectures and the material (even with a French accent) I think his class is pretty easy. But then, Western European politics is my passion...

Fantastic prof. He conveys material with absolute clarity, speaking at a pace perfect for note taking. Very interesting and engaging, and clearly enjoys his field of study. His lectures are extremely well organized and there are no surprises on his exams, and he is a very fair marker.

Great professor, very knowledgeable and passionate about his subject matter. If you show up to class you'll do well. He splits the material into 3 exams [2 midterms, final], which are quite straight forward. Andthen there is one term paper which is fairly simple. Lecours is an excellent teacher that will draw you into politics guaanteed.

Has a heavy French accent that makes it difficult to understand his lectures in English. His TA's were very hard markers, but I'm not sure how much of a reflection that is on him. His class notes are good and as long as you do the readings (which can be very dry, plus he helped write the textbook), you will do fine.
Really interesting class. Nice prof, with an easy to understand way of teaching.
